title: [BUG] mlflow sagemaker build-and-push-concontainer cmd fail with docker 4.13.0 version on mac m1 pro 16
body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

1.30.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:  MAC M1 PRO 16, 12.6.1
- **Python version**: 3.10.8
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

I run the cmd "mlflow sagemaker build-and-push-container  --build" with docker version 4.13.0

Got the error version api can't be fetched.


i downgrade docker software version from 4.13.0 to 4.12.0 and it works.


### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```
mlflow sagemaker build-and-push-container  --build
```

### Stack trace

2022/10/25 09:44:29 INFO mlflow.models.docker_utils: Building docker image with name mlflow-pyfunc
Traceback (most recent call last):

    httplib_response = self._make_request(
  File "/Users/lchen/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/land-valuation-model-dJtFYf8y-py3.10/lib/python3.10/site-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 398, in _make_request
    conn.request(method, url, **httplib_request_kw)

    self._send_request(method, url, body, headers, encode_chunked)
  File "/Users/lchen/.asdf/installs/python/3.10.8/lib/python3.10/http/client.py", line 1328, in _send_request
    self.endheaders(body, encode_chunked=encode_chunked)
  File "/Users/lchen/.asdf/installs/python/3.10.8/lib/python3.10/http/client.py", line 1277, in endheaders

    self.send(msg)
  File "/Users/lchen/.asdf/installs/python/3.10.8/lib/python3.10/http/client.py", line 975, in send

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)

  File "/Users/lchen/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/land-valuation-model-dJtFYf8y-py3.10/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/models/docker_utils.py", line 230, in _build_image_from_context

    self.api = APIClient(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/lchen/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/land-valuation-model-dJtFYf8y-py3.10/lib/python3.10/site-packages/docker/api/client.py", line 197, in __init__
    self._version = self._retrieve_server_version()
  File "/Users/lchen/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/land-valuation-model-dJtFYf8y-py3.10/lib/python3.10/site-packages/docker/api/client.py", line 221, in _retrieve_server_version
    raise DockerException(
docker.errors.DockerException: Error while fetching server API version: ('Connection aborted.', FileNotFoundError(2, 'No such file or directory')).

### Other info / logs

_No response_

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/pipelines`: Pipelines, Pipeline APIs, Pipeline configs, Pipeline Templates
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
